history.text: Good day to you! So what did you think of Batman vs superman?
It was better than Man of Steel, but  no where as good as Dark Night
Agreed. I suppose I agree with CinemaScore's rating of the film! Who was your favorite character in the movie?
Eisenburg as Lex Luthor, I liked the way he manipulated Batman into a battle with superman. How about you?
True that! He was a great criminal mastermind. I suppose my favorite was Ben as Bruce Wayne/Batman.
Yeah, Ben Affleck was great as Batman. I agree with that.
What did you think of Henry Cavill's performance as Superman/Clark Kent?
Since it was a better movie than Man of Steel, I'd say the Superman character is sub par. It was Batman that made this movie watchable.
Agreed. I did enjoy seeing the first live action cinematic portrayal of Wonder Woman!
Having Batman, Superman, and Wonder Woman all on screen at the same time was great. Probably the high point of the movie.
So true! As far as Batman is concerned, I did agree with him as seeing Superman as a threat to humanity.
I'd say the Rotten Tomatoes score of 27% is more along where I would rate this movie.
Understood. An average of 4.9/10 is honestly about right for this movie.
I agree, it was an average movie
The fact that 18 months passed since the battle between Superman and Zod seems like a bit too much time to have passed between this movie and the last.
So true! And by that time, Superman had become a controversial figure.
Using Martha was the only thing Lex Luthor had to control Superman.
Indeed. I thought Luther's plan to bring Superman out of exile by kidnapping her was brilliant.
And since Bruce Waynes late mother is also Martha, that was a good plot device.
Agreed. It bought Superman enough time for Lane to arrive and explain everything to save his life! I'm glad Batman was  able to rescue Martha!
And while Batman rescues Martha, superman confronted Lex Luthor on the Scout Ship.
That was a great scene! Luther being confronted by the man he was obsessed with defeating!
Yes, it was Superman's chance to redeem himself.
Indeed. Then Batman ended up confronting Luthor in prison!
Then batman confronts luthor in prison. And warns him that he'll be keeping an eye on him.
exactly!
I'll admit, the memorial held for superman in Metropolis was kind of sad I thought!
Clark Also being declared dead with friends and family attending including Bruce Wayne in Smallville was just as sad.
So true. Plus the envelope Martha gave Lane from Clark with an engagement ring in it was sad as well.
Bruce Wayne saying he will form a team to help protect the world was great!
Yeah it's a good thing he was able to find those meta humans in Luthor's files!
I agree completely!
Well I enjoyed discussing Batman vs Superman with you! Have a great evening!
And Same to you!

uid2response.feedback: I thoroughly enjoyed it! The other user was a joy to chat with! Thank you so much!
